page.title: 02Reading Bluecoat School
page.content: Reading Bluecoat School was founded in 1646 by Richard Aldworth,a merchant of London and Reading and also the Governor of Christ's Hospital.For 300 years it was in Reading until 1947 when it moved to the present site at {Holme Park in Sonning.}The school used to have a hospital for orphan children who wore dark blue gowns. Bluecoat School is a boys school that takes boarders and day pupils.The age group is 11 to 18 years.There are approximately 75 boarders and 405 day pupils including sixth formers. Junior boarders wear traditional Bluecoat shorts and jersey.First to fifth year wear a navy blue blazer and grey trousers. Sixth formers may wear sports jackets or suits.
